biogHist.abstract: MacKillop Family Services was established in 1997 to continue the services (foster care, residential care and specialised home-based care services) to children, young people and families previously undertaken by the Sisters of Mercy, the Christian Brothers, and the Sisters of St Joseph. It is based in Melbourne, and is a leading provider of services for children, young people and families in Victoria and New South Wales. It is also establishing a presence in Western Australia.
biogHist.p: MacKillop Family Services' out-of-home care services provide support and accommodation to children and young people unable to live at home, through residential care, foster care and lead tenant programs. MacKillop Family Services' Community Programs support vulnerable and disadvantaged children, young people and their families through a range of programs and services including education, disability services, family and community services and family relationship services.

MacKillop Family Services' Refugee Services works in partnership with local community organisations to provide assistance and support to asylum seekers who are unaccompanied minors. In addition, MacKillop Family Services' homelessness services in New South Wales support young people who are experiencing, or are at risk of experiencing, homelessness.

chronItem.event: Location - Mackillop Family Services was located in South Melbourne

cpfRelation.relationEntry: St Vincent de Paul Child and Family Services (1992 - 1997)

descriptiveNote.p: In 1997, St Vincent de Paul Child and Family Services became part of MacKillop Family Services.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: St Vincent de Paul's Boys' Home (1967 - 1997?)

descriptiveNote.p: In 1997, St Vincent de Paul's Boys' Home became part of MacKillop Family Services.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: St Augustine's Adolescent and Family Services (1988 - 1997)

descriptiveNote.p: In 1997, St Augustine's Adolescent and Family Services became part of MacKillop Family Services.
In 1997, Mercy Family Care Centre became part of MacKillop Family Services.
In 1997, St Anthony's Family Service became part of MacKillop Family Services.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Christian Brothers' Child Youth and Family Services (1995 - 1997)
St Joseph's Babies' and Family Service (1985 - 1997)

descriptiveNote.p: In 1997, St Joseph's Babies' and Family Service became part of MacKillop Family Services.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Institute of the Sisters of Mercy of Australia (1981 - 2011)

descriptiveNote.p: MacKillop Family Services acquired the records of institutions run by the Sisters of Mercy, Melbourne, which was a member of the Institute of the Sisters of Mercy of Australia.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Institute of Sisters of Mercy of Australia and Papua New Guinea (2011 - )

descriptiveNote.p: The MacKillop Family Services Records include records of institutions run by the Sisters of Mercy, Melbourne, which was a previous entity to the Institute of the Sisters of Mercy of Australia and Papua New Guinea.
In 1997, MacKillop Family Services was formed to continue to provide services to children, young people and families formerly run by the the Sisters of St Joseph.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Heritage and Information Service, MacKillop Family Services (1997 - )

descriptiveNote.p: The Heritage and Information Service is part of MacKillop Family Services.
MacKillop Family Services was a partner Community Service Organisation (CSO) in the Who Am I? project.
